article.headline: Arkansas 78, Vanderbilt 66
article.story: FAYETTEVILLE, Ark. (AP) -- Arkansas coach Stan Heath understood how important a win was over Vanderbilt on Saturday -- after two straight losses to start the SEC season. "It would have been really hard to be 0-3 at this particular time, no doubt about it," Heath said. "They were tense. They wanted those last two wins and we didn't get them. But this team now, I think, will feel better about itself." Jonathon Modica scored 19 points, and the Razorbacks pulled away late in the second half for a 78-66 win over the Commodores. Vanderbilt (11-3, 2-1 Southeastern Conference) trailed by 11 at halftime, but rallied to tie it at 55 on Derrick Byars' 3-pointer with 7:07 remaining. Arkansas answered with an 11-2 run. Darian Townes made two free throws, a dunk and a shot from the low post, helping the Razorbacks move ahead 61-57. Modica's 3-point play with 4:31 remaining made it 64-57, and Modica added a transition layup on Arkansas' next possession to push the lead to nine. "We did a good job of getting back in the game in the second half, but we ran out of gas," Vanderbilt coach Kevin Stallings said. "You have to play really well on the road to win in this league. We didn't and they did." Vanderbilt was seeking its first 3-0 SEC start since 1990. The Commodores beat Kentucky 57-52 Tuesday night, their first victory over the Wildcats in Lexington since 1974. Vanderbilt hasn't won at Arkansas since 1996. Shan Foster scored 22 points for Vanderbilt, 17 in the second half. Byars had 17 points and six assists. "We could never get over the top," Byars said. "We prepared well for this game but did not match Arkansas' intensity and that was the difference." Reserve Charles Thomas scored 15 points for the Razorbacks, and Ronnie Brewer added nine points and 11 rebounds. Arkansas (12-4, 1-2) outrebounded Vanderbilt 39-20, an important advantage since the Commodores had only 11 turnovers to the Razorbacks' 18. "One of two things has to happen -- we either have to turn you over, or we have to outrebound you," Heath said. "Against a team that's highly skilled ... it was really important for us to rebound, because we probably weren't going to turn them over a whole lot." Arkansas was outrebounded 44-34 in Wednesday night's 63-58 loss to LSU. The Razorbacks blew a 12-point first-half lead in that game. Against Vanderbilt, Arkansas led 34-23 at halftime, then withstood an impressive stretch of 3-point shooting by the Commodores. After holding LSU without a 3-pointer, Arkansas allowed Vanderbilt to shoot 11-of-22 from long distance. The Commodores are one of three teams -- UNLV and Princeton are the others -- to make a 3-pointer in every game since the extra-point shot was enacted for the 1986-87 season. "They are better from outside than inside," Heath said. "They were difficult to guard." The Razorbacks answered with their aggressiveness. Vanderbilt's Julian Terrell and Ted Skuchas both fouled out -- Skuchas after playing only 19 minutes -- and Arkansas took advantage. "We got their big men in foul trouble, so they relaxed in the post, and we decided to attack them," Townes said. "This was a big win. We controlled the tempo throughout the game." Arkansas shot 24-of-32 from the free throw line, enjoying a significant advantage over Vanderbilt, which finished 11-of-13. "They got to the foul line a lot," Stallings said. "We were never able to get into a flow because we would foul or didn't rebound."

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
